reasoning: Nephrotic syndrome is a clinical syndrome resulting from various primary and secondary renal diseases. Reporting both incidence (~1.2 per 100k person-years for new diagnoses) and prevalence (~45 per 100k) given chronic nature. Incidence estimates based on pooled data from developed countries with systematic kidney disease surveillance; variation by region and underlying cause (MCD most common in children, FSGS/membranous in adults). Prevalence higher due to chronicity.
source: Based on multicenter nephrology registry data and literature review; no single 2005-specific global estimate available
